properties.comment: This configuration provides locale-dependent names for labels in a (graphical) user interface. The separator ";" can be used to separate actual labels from associated tool tips.
properties.entry: %d data columns from the given input file could not be automatically assigned to expected columns. Please manually assign these columns here.
Indicate whether a file contains column descriptions or not.
The separator character that is used to split the columns.
Indicate whether multiple consecutive separators should be treated as one.
Skip that much lines at the beginning of the file.
This memorizes the last files that have been opened by the program.
Decide whether or not this program should search for updates at start-up.
Can be used in combination with = true or = false or just --gui. Specifies whether or not a program should display its graphical user interface.
The language for the user interface, error messages and so on.
Standard directory where user files can be found.
Standard directory where the user may save some files.
Define the default directories to open and save files. These directories will be used as the first search target when selecting files in this graphical user interface.
%s %s already exists. Do you really want to overwrite it?
This is the main online help.
Save the current page as HTML file.
Apply;Persistently saves the current configuration but keeps the dialog open.
Cancel;Closes this dialog without saving, i.e., all preferences will get lost.
Defaults;Restores the default configuration, i.e., all current preferences will be replaced by the default values.
OK;Saves the current configuration and closes this dialog.

Update notification:
--------------------
A new version of %s is available.
Please visit %s
to obtain version %s.
For your information: you are now using %s version %s.
You are already using the latest version %s of %s. No newer version could be found.
